content.question: Which of the following best explains why the code segment does not work as intended?

choices.label: The code segment does not compile because the call to the  Item  constructor uses incorrect syntax.
The  Item  class does not compile because the  getPrice  method does not have access to a variable named  price.
The instance variable  price  is not assigned a value in the  Item  constructor because the constructor does not return a value.
The instance variable  price  is not assigned a value in the  Item  constructor because the constructor assigns a value to the parameter instead of the instance variable.

content.answer: The instance variable  price  is not assigned a value in the  Item  constructor because the constructor assigns a value to the parameter instead of the instance variable.

skill.text: 3.D: Explain why a code segment will not compile or work as intended and modify the code to correct the error.
